title: New Mountain-Backed Signify Health Shares Surge in Public Debut
sub_head: After its IPO priced at $24 a share, the healthcare company’s shares surged nearly 32% Thursday
body:
Shares of New Mountain Capital-backed Signify Health Inc. closed nearly 32% higher Thursday after the technology-enabled healthcare company’s initial public offering priced above the expected range.
The Norwalk, Conn.-based company’s shares reached as high as $33.50 on the New York Stock Exchange after pricing at $24 late Wednesday. The shares, listed under the ticker SGFY, closed regular trading at $31.56.
Signify Health uses technology and healthcare provider networks to drive and create value-based payment programs. Its customers include health plans, employers, health systems, governments and physician groups, according to the company’s IPO registration filing.
The company’s IPO priced above the top of an expected range of $20 to $21 a share. The offering of about 23.5 million shares raised more than $500 million for the company.
The business focuses on driving better health outcomes while saving money, according to Kyle Armbrester, Signify’s chief executive. The company concentrates on getting ahead of catastrophic health events—through technology and outreach—aiming to help clients and their patients avoid unnecessarily expensive care, he said.
